intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion nobile subsp. lamyi, commonly known as the noble hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems with rough, hairy surfaces. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets that are often shorter than the disk florets, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. The leaves are basal and alternate, with a distinctive lobed or toothed margin, contributing to its ornamental appeal in gardens.
